intro: Cryptandra gunnii, commonly known as the Gunns cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland heathlands. It is a shrub that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
